BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The danger of natural moist avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as in high Alpine regions deep wind slabs formed.
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant and generally above the tree line.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are to be expected. In the regions with a lot of snow and on wind-loaded slopes more large avalanches are possible, in particular in case of releases originating from starting zones that still retain some snow, caution is to be exercised in particular at the base of rock walls, as well as on extremely steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
As a consequence of warming moist and wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they can reach medium size in some cases, in particular on steep sunny slopes, as well as at the base of rock walls in all altitude zones. Individual gliding avalanches can also occur.
The wind slabs of the last few days are to be evaluated with care and prudence on very steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Caution is to be exercised in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, as well as in places that are protected from the wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as in high Alpine regions large wind slabs formed.
More recent wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2300 m.
As a consequence of warming during the day medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible below approximately 2500 m, in particular in case of releases originating from starting zones that still retain some snow, caution is to be exercised in particular at the base of rock walls, as well as on extremely steep sunny slopes.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
At intermediate and high altitudes a lot of snow is lying for the time of year.
In isolated cases new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days further medium-sized to large avalanches were observed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as in high Alpine regions large wind slabs formed.
More recent wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2300 m.
As a consequence of warming during the day medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible below approximately 2500 m, in particular in case of releases originating from starting zones that still retain some snow, caution is to be exercised in particular at the base of rock walls, as well as on extremely steep sunny slopes.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
At intermediate and high altitudes a lot of snow is lying for the time of year.
In isolated cases new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days further medium-sized to large avalanches were observed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs of the last few days can still be released above the tree line. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as in high Alpine regions mostly small wind slabs formed. They can be released even by a single winter sport participant at intermediate and high altitudes. In addition the danger of dry and moist avalanches will increase in the late morning.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2700 m. In particular in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation only isolated medium-sized to large avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes.
The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to gradual moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. The surface of the snowpack will cool hardly at all during the overcast night will already soften in the late morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs of the last few days can still be released above the tree line. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as in high Alpine regions mostly small wind slabs formed. They can be released even by a single winter sport participant at intermediate and high altitudes. In addition the danger of dry and moist avalanches will increase in the late morning.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2700 m. In particular in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation only isolated medium-sized to large avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes.
The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to gradual moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. The surface of the snowpack will cool hardly at all during the overcast night will already soften in the late morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Natural moist avalanches are still possible. Caution is to be exercised in particular below very steep starting zones that still retain some snow.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The older wind slabs are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. These can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases at intermediate and high altitudes. The prevalence of these avalanche prone locations will increase in the late morning.
As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the avalanche activity will rapidly increase. More medium-sized to large moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2700 m. This applies in particular in case of releases originating from very steep starting zones that still retain some snow.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days small and medium-sized avalanches were observed. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already soften in the late morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Natural moist avalanches are still possible. Caution is to be exercised in particular below very steep starting zones that still retain some snow.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The older wind slabs are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. These can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases at intermediate and high altitudes. The prevalence of these avalanche prone locations will increase in the late morning.
As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the avalanche activity will rapidly increase. More medium-sized to large moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2700 m. This applies in particular in case of releases originating from very steep starting zones that still retain some snow.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days small and medium-sized avalanches were observed. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already soften in the late morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Slight increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
A partly overcast night: The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze. This applies in particular below approximately 2200 m.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes more medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2500 m.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded early.

As a consequence of a moderate to strong wind from westerly directions, clearly visible wind slabs formed in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas as well as above approximately 2500 m. They can especially at their margins be released, even by a single winter sport participant. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In particular along the border with Switzerland, along the border with France 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell on Saturday above approximately 2500 m. The wind was moderate to strong at times.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is largely stable and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases. This applies on steep sunny slopes.
The snowpack is dry; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow, in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2200 m.

The weather conditions facilitated a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes.
On very steep sunny slopes several medium-sized to large avalanches were observed.

Sunday: Afternoon: In particular in the northwest light snowfall above approximately 2100 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Monday: In particular along the border with France a little new snow above approximately 2000 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In all aspects medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. In addition the wind slabs must be taken into account.
As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in all regions. Snow slides and natural avalanches are still possible. This applies in particular in steep rocky terrain.
Avalanches can as before be released, in particular by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust. The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes. Weak layers exist in the snowpack. In addition large wind slabs formed also adjacent to ridgelines.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be partly cloudy over a wide area.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be in most cases moist. Gliding avalanches can be released at any time of day or night.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Individual, then as a consequence of solar radiation more, and in some cases even large, gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2500 m. As a consequence of mild temperatures and solar radiation the snowpack can not consolidate.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be in most cases moist. Gliding avalanches can be released at any time of day or night.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Individual, then as a consequence of solar radiation more, and in some cases even large, gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2500 m. As a consequence of mild temperatures and solar radiation the snowpack can not consolidate.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering. Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Especially slopes adjacent to ridgelines are unfavourable. Avalanches can in very isolated cases reach medium size.

On steep grassy slopes more gliding avalanches are possible, in particular medium-sized ones. This applies especially on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

During the day:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a gradual increase in the danger of wet snow slides, in particular on very steep sunny slopes. As a consequence of the rain natural wet avalanches are possible towards the evening, even medium-sized ones, especially on shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften quickly. Up to 2000 m and above rain will fall in the evening. These spring-like weather conditions will give rise to increasing and thorough wetting of the snowpack.

Fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are lying on soft layers on wind-protected shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack on west, north and east facing slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Some snow will fall in particular in the north. Gliding avalanches can also occur.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering. Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Especially slopes adjacent to ridgelines are unfavourable. Avalanches can in very isolated cases reach medium size.

On steep grassy slopes more gliding avalanches are possible, in particular medium-sized ones. This applies especially on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

During the day:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a gradual increase in the danger of wet snow slides, in particular on very steep sunny slopes. As a consequence of the rain natural wet avalanches are possible towards the evening, even medium-sized ones, especially on shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften quickly. Up to 2000 m and above rain will fall in the evening. These spring-like weather conditions will give rise to increasing and thorough wetting of the snowpack.

Fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are lying on soft layers on wind-protected shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack on west, north and east facing slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Some snow will fall in particular in the north. Gliding avalanches can also occur.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day the prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
By Monday clearly visible wind slabs formed in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as above approximately 2200 m. These can be released, especially by large additional loads, at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
As a consequence of warming during the day more small and medium-sized gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible below approximately 2400 m.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
A lot of snow is lying in all altitude zones. The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will soften earlier than the day before. The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days on very steep sunny slopes mostly small avalanches were observed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day the prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
By Monday clearly visible wind slabs formed in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as above approximately 2200 m. These can be released, especially by large additional loads, at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
As a consequence of warming during the day more small and medium-sized gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible below approximately 2400 m.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
A lot of snow is lying in all altitude zones. The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will soften earlier than the day before. The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days on very steep sunny slopes mostly small avalanches were observed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The new snow of recent weeks can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2800 m. The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to rapid softening of the snowpack over a wide area especially at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The snowpack will be prone to triggering in particular on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: A clear night will be followed in the early morning by sometimes favourable conditions generally, but the danger of wet and gliding avalanches will increase later.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The new snow of recent weeks can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2800 m. The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to rapid softening of the snowpack over a wide area especially at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The snowpack will be prone to triggering in particular on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: A clear night will be followed in the early morning by sometimes favourable conditions generally, but the danger of wet and gliding avalanches will increase later.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in all regions. In all aspects small and medium-sized avalanches are possible. Gliding avalanches are possible. Avalanches can as before be released, in particular by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be partly cloudy over a wide area.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering. Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Avalanches can in very isolated cases reach medium size. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase with altitude. Especially slopes adjacent to ridgelines are unfavourable. Avalanches can in very isolated cases be triggered in the old snowpack and reach quite a large size. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation more wet loose snow avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses.
From origins in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place more gliding avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m. Caution is to be exercised in areas with glide cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are lying on soft layers on wind-protected shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack in particular on west, north and east facing slopes.

Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. The spring-like weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2400 m. This also applies on steep sunny slopes at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Some snow will fall in particular in the north. Wet loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Gliding avalanches can also occur.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering. Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Avalanches can in very isolated cases reach medium size. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase with altitude. Especially slopes adjacent to ridgelines are unfavourable. Avalanches can in very isolated cases be triggered in the old snowpack and reach quite a large size. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation more wet loose snow avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses.
From origins in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place more gliding avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m. Caution is to be exercised in areas with glide cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are lying on soft layers on wind-protected shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack in particular on west, north and east facing slopes.

Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. The spring-like weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2400 m. This also applies on steep sunny slopes at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Some snow will fall in particular in the north. Wet loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Gliding avalanches can also occur.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation more wet loose snow avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small.
On steep grassy slopes more gliding avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m. Caution is to be exercised in areas with glide cracks.

Wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads, on extremely steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Caution is to be exercised adjacent to ridgelines.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. The spring-like weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2400 m. This also applies on steep sunny slopes at elevated altitudes.

Wind slabs have bonded well with the old snowpack. They are only small and unlikely to be released now.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Individual wet loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Gliding avalanches can also occur.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet and gliding snow require caution. Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found on extremely steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation more wet loose snow avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small.
On steep grassy slopes individual gliding avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m. Caution is to be exercised in areas with glide cracks.

Wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads, on extremely steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. Caution is to be exercised adjacent to ridgelines.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. The spring-like weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2400 m. This also applies on steep sunny slopes at elevated altitudes.

Wind slabs have bonded well with the old snowpack. They are only small and unlikely to be released now.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Individual wet loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Gliding avalanches can also occur.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Natural moist avalanches and wet snow slides and avalanches are the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized wet snow slides and avalanches are possible above approximately 1900 m. In gullies and bowls and on steep sunny slopes the avalanche situation is more dangerous. This applies in particular on east, south and west facing slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Below approximately 1900 m only a little snow is lying. The older wind slabs are to be found especially in gullies and bowls and at high altitudes. The weather conditions fostered a slight rise in the danger of moist and wet avalanches in particular on steep sunny slopes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The old snowpack will be generally wet all the way through.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual weakening of the snowpack as the day progresses.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The old snowpack will be generally wet all the way through.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual weakening of the snowpack as the day progresses.
